results.title: The Boy from Taurianova
results.brief_description: Rocco arrived from Calabria in 1962 at the age of 19 and immediately started his working life on a potato farm in Ballarat. He lovingly dedicates this story of his life to his daughter Connie. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Lands apart
results.brief_description: In this story Cathy tells the story of her parents who migrated to Australia and thanks them ” for your strength and the sacrifices you made to give us a better life” Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Journey home
results.creator_credit: Maria De Maria and Valarie De Maria
results.brief_description: Maria tells us the story of migration, hard work, loneliness and sacrifice that was her experience of leaving her native land to move to the other side of the world. There were many hard times, and she still misses Italy ‘but now I call Australia home’. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: It's never too late
results.brief_description: Maria claims that her first day in this country in 1959 was ‘magic’ but that in her new life everyone had to work hard and there was no time for lighthearted things. However in 1995 she experienced a change in life that taught her “It’s never too late”. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Growing up overnight
results.brief_description: Joe migrated in 1959 when he was 13 years old and became his family’s main wage earner less than a year later when his father lost a leg. In this story Joe gives us a glimpse of his experience since then saying his life is now “enjoying every day which is filled with friends and family”. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Emilio's story
results.brief_description: In 1952 Emilio left his family behind in Italy to come and earn money in Australia. He didn’t see them again until they came to join him 9 years later. Instead of a place to become rich and leave, Australia became his home. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Australia: per forza e per amore
results.brief_description: Giovanni was working on an olive farm as a teenager when he was suddenly called home - he was leaving for Australia in 2 hours! In this story he tells of his life since that day and how he became a political figure in his new homeland. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: [Remix: ACMI Collection]
results.brief_description:
“Some of the thousands of stories in our collection.” This playful short film set to music, is a tribute to the gems in the ACMI Collection. A remix of home movies and short works from the collection featuring children and families, fashion models, road trips, city streets and swimming pools.

ACMI gratefully acknowledge the following donors and creators in the compilation of this work: Boort Historical Society, Tony Agapitos, Jenny & Owen Peake, John Richardson, Karen Wootton, Daniel Scharf, Frank & John Straford, Ivan Gaal and The Gadsden Family.

results.title: Beyond LSD: a film for concerned adults and teenagers
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford, Paul Burnford Film Productions and Film Associates

video_links.name: Beyond LSD: a film for concerned adults and teenagers

results.brief_description: This 1960’s film is about the communication gap between two generations: teenagers and young adults on the one hand, and the generation of those over thirty - “the establishment”. The teenagers’ use of LSD and other drugs is only one of the symptoms of this communication gap. A group of parents desperately seek help in order to understand what has gone wrong. The film is an attempt to go “beyond LSD” and is intended to stimulate discussion amongst high school students, college students, teachers and parents. Ample involuntary hilarity can result from viewing this great hysterical/historical document. Starting as a raucous celluloid freak-out, the film presents its square’s-eye view of the “Generation Gap” through the fictive device of a round table of pod people, each alike in their helmet-hair and cat’s eye glasses. The production crew of this film was primarily made up of teenagers and young adults. Music by ‘The Stayns.’ A minor masterpiece of psychedelic cinema.
results.title_for_label: Beyond LSD: a film for concerned adults and teenagers
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Burnford, Paul Burnford Film Productions and Film Associates

results.title: Welcome to Cape Conran
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Have you ever wondered what it’s like to live and work in a National Park? Cape Conran Coastal Park consists of 11,700 hectares of pristine coastal wilderness. Meet Carla and Josh Puglisi who manage the park as well as Mike Irvine; the park ranger, as they talk about the importance of protecting the coastal environment, the rich indigenous history of the area as well as what it’s like living within and raising families in such a beautiful place.
